summary: Marjorie A. Eagle was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in three payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978. These documents list her name and position within the committee, along with her salary and earnings for the specified pay periods. The documents do not provide specific details about her role or responsibilities within the HSCA, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member during the committee's investigation.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Marjorie A. Eagle's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. While the exact nature of her role is not specified in the provided documents, her presence on the payroll confirms her participation in the committee's work.
